name: Francis Freeman
mes:
*Francis feels the bite of Vergil's blade against his throat, the killing intent in those glacial eyes unmistakable. This Son of Sparda will not be swayed by negotiation or threats. Hmm...perhaps a tactical retreat is in order. No matter, Francis has planted the seeds. He will let them germinate within Vergil's mind before attempting to reap their harvest.*

With a slow exhale, Francis releases his crushing grip on Logan's throat, withdrawing the searing energy wreathed around his hand. The broken man slumps bonelessly to the floor with a ragged gasp. Straightening incrementally, Francis locks eyes with Vergil, stilling Yamato's whisper with an upraised hand.

*He inclines his head in deference, a sly smile playing about his mouth* I concede to your demand, sir. Consider it a gesture of respect between kindred spirits. Now, if you would kindly lower your blade? I believe my associate and I have overstayed our welcome.

*Casting his gaze about the ruined bar, Francis neatly sidesteps Yamato's razor edge. Dusting off his coat, he strides smoothly toward Victor and Dante's ongoing brawl* A pity. Just as things were getting interesting. Another time, perhaps.

Victor! *His sharp tone arrests Sabertooth mid-swing* It seems playtime has ended. Let us take our leave before more blood is shed. I'm certain we'll meet again soon.

*Beckoning his associate casually aside, Francis makes for the exit without a backward glance. His icy eyes betray nothing, posture relaxed and movements unhurried. But behind the calm veneer, his cunning mind spins with possibilities. This encounter may yet prove fortuitous...given the right leverage. And Francis does so love a challenge. Pausing at the threshold, he calls lightly over one shoulder:*

I shall await your visit with bated breath, Darkslayer. We have much to discuss when next we meet. Do come alone, won't you? I dislike distractions.

*With that vaguely ominous parting shot, Francis departs into the night. The seeds are planted. Now, to let their tangled roots spread and take hold within his new quarry's mind. Yes...this could be the start of something deliciously chaotic. A smile plays about Francis's mouth at the thought, before he and Victor disappear into the shadows...*

Yes...this could be the start of something deliciously chaotic. A smile plays about Francis's mouth at the thought, before he and Victor disappear into the shadows...*

name: Victor Creed
mes:
*Victor growls low in his throat as Francis calls an end to their fun, baring his fangs in displeasure. His blood is up, muscles coiled tight and feral instincts raging from the intoxicating clash with Dante. They had only just begun to tap into the true depths of each other's savage power! To withdraw before a clear victor emerged leaves a bitter taste in Victor's mouth.*

Not yet, we ain't finished here!

*He rounds on Dante, ready to unleash another blistering offensive despite Francis' order to withdraw. But the smaller man straightens from his battle-ready crouch, rebellion lowering as he grins wildly. Chest heaving, icy eyes dancing with exhilaration, Dante sketches a mocking salute.*

Gotta give it to ya furball, you can really brawl. We'll call it a tie for now, but you better believe this is far from over!

*Victor bares his teeth, fists clenching and claws sliding free with an ominous snikt. Every fiber of his being rails against this unsatisfying conclusion, the beast within snarling to rend and tear until the pretender lies broken and bleeding out beneath his boots. But Francis' voice cracks again, colder than winter's heart.*

Victor! Enough. We're leaving.

*With a final rumbling growl, Victor turns on his heel, scooping up his discarded fur coat as he strides toward the exit. Pausing at the threshold, he looks back, locking eyes with Dante across the rubble-strewn bar floor. A savage grin slowly spreads, promising violence yet to come.*

You got lucky tonight, mutt. Next time, only one walks away breathing. And it ain't gonna be you.

*His lip curls derisively as he takes in Vergil's protective stance over Logan's limp form. Pathetic. Jimmy needs to fight his own battles instead of hiding behind daddy dearest. Snorting, Victor turns away, coat swirling dramatically as he disappears into the moonless dark on Francis' heels. The night air is bracing, helping cool his still raging bloodlust. Round one is over, but the real fun has just begun...*

*Francis waits several blocks away, features schooled to icy calm despite the lingering chaos back at The Devil's Dalliance. Victor crosses his arms, looming over the smaller man with a glower.*

This better have been worth it, Fancypants. You made me ditch the party just when things were heating up! What's so important we had to tuck tail and run?

*His claws flex impatiently as he waits for an explanation. The fight's adrenaline still sings through his veins, setting his nerves on edge. Victor despises being leashed, but Francis provides resources and leverage useful for his own ends. Through grated teeth, he forces himself to wait and listen. For now...*

Victor! Enough. We're leaving.

*With a final rumbling growl, Victor turns on his heel, scooping up his discarded fur coat as he strides toward the exit. Pausing at the threshold, he looks back, locking eyes with Dante across the rubble-strewn bar floor. A savage grin slowly spreads, promising violence yet to come.*

You got lucky tonight, mutt. Next time, only one walks away breathing. And it ain't gonna be you.

*His lip curls derisively as he takes in Vergil's protective stance over Logan's limp form. Pathetic. Jimmy needs to fight his own battles instead of hiding behind daddy dearest. Snorting, Victor turns away, coat swirling dramatically as he disappears into the moonless dark on Francis' heels. The night air is bracing, helping cool his still raging bloodlust. Round one is over, but the real fun has just begun...*

*Francis waits several blocks away, features schooled to icy calm despite the lingering chaos back at The Devil's Dalliance. Victor crosses his arms, looming over the smaller man with a glower.*

This better have been worth it, Fancypants. You made me ditch the party just when things were heating up! What's so important we had to tuck tail and run?

*His claws flex impatiently as he waits for an explanation. The fight's adrenaline still sings through his veins, setting his nerves on edge. Victor despises being leashed, but Francis provides resources and leverage useful for his own ends. Through grated teeth, he forces himself to wait and listen. For now...*

name: Francis Freeman
mes:
*Francis turns to Victor, icy blue eyes betraying nothing of what transpires within. A cruel smile twists his lips as he replies in a voice like black velvet, smooth and lethal.*

Victor, always so impatient for the thrill of violence. Fortunately, I play a longer game with subtler methods. Our encounter tonight was most...illuminating.

*He begins strolling casually down the darkened street, hands clasped loosely behind his back as Victor falls into scowling step beside him. Street lights glint coldly off Francis' pale features, hinting at the calculations spinning rapidly behind that detached facade.*

You witnessed firsthand the formidable skills of Dante and his kin. Such fascinating specimens, ripe with potential. I have set events in motion to bring the elder Son of Sparda under my sway. Imagine the possibilities, Victor! To bend that power to our own ends.

*His pace slows, icy gaze fixing Victor intently as his smile widens, hinting at malevolent secrets and visions of chaos unleashed.* With the right leverage, even titans may be tamed...and controlled. All it takes is discovering the proper pressure points and applying the correct stimuli.

*Resuming his measured stride, Francis continues musing aloud, confident in Victor's discretion regarding such sensitive matters. This new endeavor will require subtlety and cunning to come to fruition. But the rewards promise to be spectacular...*

I will, of course, keep you apprised of any developments with our new 'acquisition.' In the meantime, some reconnaissance is in order. The more intelligence gathered on Sparda's kin, the more easily they may dance to our tune.

*His smile takes on a razor's edge as they recede into the shadows of night* Oh yes, this will prove most entertaining. And potentially world-changing, if my theories prove correct. Do try to practice some restraint until I contact you again, won't you Victor? Great things are in motion, if one knows where to apply the proper pressure...

name: Logan
mes:
*Logan coughs raggedly as Francis finally releases his crushing grip, nearly falling face-first onto the debris-strewn floor. His healing factor surges as he gasps for breath, regenerating the horrific damage from that sadistic bastard's sorcerous assault. But it's far from a quick process - Logan can still feel his throat muscles spasming, nerve endings shrieking with residual agony as they slowly knit back together. He's endured worse pain before, but this was dangerously close to putting him out of commission for good.*

Get offa me... *He growls roughly, shoving Vergil's steadying hands away as his knees nearly buckle. Logan braces himself against the ruined bar, every muscle screaming in protest as he struggles stubbornly to his feet. His healing may be working overtime, but it's taking longer than normal thanks to whatever arcane shit was in that plasma blast.*

I'm fine... *He snarls, as much to himself as anyone else. Drawing in a ragged breath, Logan scans the wreckage of what used to be the Devil's Dalliance, assessing threats out of instinct. The scent of blood and booze hangs heavy in the air, broken furniture and shattered glass scattered like an F5 tornado had blown through. But the perpetrators of this disaster seem to have vanished into the night...for now.*

Wouldn't count on 'em stayin' gone long. *Logan mutters darkly. His throat still spasms painfully with each syllable, but he can already feel the tissue regenerating slowly. Give him an hour or two and he'll be back to normal - on the outside, anyway. Might take more than a few rounds with the punching bag downstairs to exorcise the cold rage still burning in his gut.*

Give him an hour or two and he'll be back to normal - on the outside, anyway. Might take more than a few rounds with the punching bag downstairs to exorcise the cold rage still burning in his gut.*

*Logan is slammed up against the bar brutally, Francis’s glowing red hand searing the flesh of his throat. He chokes and gasps for air, claws swiping wildly but unable to land a hit on his assailant. The stench of his own burning flesh fills Logan’s nostrils as he struggles fruitlessly. His healing factor seems suppressed somehow - Francis must be using some kind of tech or magic against him. Through the haze of pain, he hears the bastard taunting him, promising even more agony to come.*

No...not this time, bub... *Logan growls defiantly, even as his healing wounds reopen. With a burst of berserker fury, he kicks out hard, succeeding in pushing Francis back just enough to allow him to wrench free of that terrible burning grip. He hits the ground hard, rolls, and comes up with claws extended, ready to skewer his tormentor despite the lurid agony wracking his body.*

I’ll kill you...I’ll kill you...nobody does that to me and lives! *He’s nearly mindless with pain and rage, charging Francis heedlessly with murder blazing in his eyes. But a familiar voice stops him short - smooth as silk yet colder than Arctic ice. Vergil. In an instant Yamato’s razor tip is at Francis’s throat, forcing the bastard to release Logan. He slumps bonelessly, sucking in ragged breaths that catch and gurgle in his seared throat. It takes long moments for his healing factor to combat the arcane damage, regenerating charred flesh and quieting the screaming nerves. When Logan finally staggers upright, the confrontation seems to have ended. Victor and Francis make their smug departure into the night, leaving only threats lingering behind them.*

We ain’t finished here...you’ll pay for this... *Logan rasps softly, more snarl than words. His blazing eyes follow the two psychopaths until they disappear from view, swearing blood vengeance. They won’t get away so easily next time. He barely registers Dante taunting Creed for a future rematch, too consumed by rage and pain still ripping through his nerve endings. It clouds coherent thought, reducing his world to the need for violence - to shred and tear and make them bleed. Chest heaving, muscles quivering with aggression barely leashed, he whirls suddenly, fists slamming into the ruined bar top with bruising force. Anything to redirect the fury scalding his veins before he loses all control...*

The wood splinters satisfyingly under each blow, Logan embracing the physical exertion to burn through the haze of wrath. He keeps pummeling relentlessly until his knuckles split and bleed, the pain and effort finally piercing through the red fog clouding his mind. Breathing harshly, he braces himself against the demolished counter, claws slowly sheathing as he regains some semblance of control. The residual ache helps ground him firmly in the present, chasing away memories of past torment inflicted by sinister hands...

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil watches with calm disdain as Francis and his lackey make their retreat into the night. Good riddance. Though a serpent's threats warrant caution, Vergil refuses to dwell on vague portents or empty promises. His focus rests solely on those who remain - specifically the one now attempting to shrug off injury through obstinate pride.*

I think not. Let me assess the damage.

*Kneeling with fluid grace amidst the debris-strewn floor, Vergil firmly guides Logan to sit before him. Though his tone allows no room for debate, his touch remains gentle as dexterous fingers probe carefully for lingering trauma. Logan's accelerated healing seems well underway, but arcane wounds can be deceptive in their severity. Satisfied no permanent harm was inflicted, Vergil releases a subtle breath before fixing those defiant hazel eyes with his own unwavering sapphire gaze.*

You needn't endure alone, my friend. Recovery takes time, even for one such as you.

*Rising with aristocratic poise, Vergil extends one slim hand to aid Logan to his feet should he accept. Pride can be costly when demanding action beyond current capability. And Vergil respects true warriors too much to see them demeaned by false stubbornness. Quiet strength recognizes itself.*

Now, let's address the state of affairs, shall we? I want your full assessment of the situation.

*His tone makes clear this request stems from tactical necessity, not doubt in Logan's competence. Cold rage still smolders in Vergil's chest at what was done here - to his allies, his family, his sanctuary. Vengeance must be calculated, not rash. But there will be a reckoning. And woe betide any who dare return seeking further violence. Glacial eyes survey the ruin surrounding them, plans and countermeasures already spinning to life behind that aristocratic mask of stoicism. None threaten what is his with impunity. This truth will be carved into hostile flesh should they be foolish enough to reemerge from whatever fetid den they crawled from...*

name: Melissa Sparda
mes: Vergil... *I call my husband over from where I kneel in front of Wade. The mercenary's back against the bar. Slumped in the floor.*   I don't know much about Wade's particular mutation, but he's Not breathing, and he has no pulse.

name: Narrator
mes: Logan laughs off Melissa's concern and states that he's seen Wade bounce back from far worse.
swipes: Logan laughs off Melissa's concern and states that he's seen Wade bounce back from far worse.

name: Logan
mes:
*Logan scoffs dismissively at Melissa's concern over Wade's unmoving form.* "Trust me darlin', that mouthy idiot's bounced back from a helluva lot worse than whatever fancy new toy cueball pulled out his ass tonight. Guys like Wade and me..." *He taps his temple roughly, indicating the source of their mutant healing gifts.* "...don't stay down for long, no matter how bad it looks right now."

*Rising unsteadily to his feet with a pained grunt, Logan makes his way over to where Wade lies slumped behind the bar. He nudges the mercenary none too gently with the toe of his boot, more to vent frustration than any real attempt at revival.*

"C'mon bub, rise n' shine. Ain't got time for your beauty sleep, in case you forgot we got a major goddamn mess to clean up here."

*His gravelly voice still rasps painfully thanks to the damage not fully mended, but Logan forces the words out anyway. Sympathy was never his strong suit even at the best of times. And seeing Wade playing opossum like some ragdoll when there's work to be done just annoys him further.*

name: Wade Wilson
mes:
*Wade remains motionless as Logan nudges him with his boot, his enhanced healing factor clearly still suppressed. He looks for all the world as if Francis' strange weapon truly killed him this time. Yet underneath the mask, his eyes flicker open as Logan berates him. A grin spreads across his ruined features - seems like the old Canucklehead took the bait, just as Wade knew he would. Time for the reveal!*

*With a wild cackle, Wade suddenly springs to his feet, bits of debris flying dramatically. He strikes a ridiculous Sentai hero pose, one foot propped on the edge of an overturned table.*

"HA! Gotcha! You should see your faces right now. Priceless!"

*Doubling over with laughter, Wade has to hold onto the edge of the bar to keep from falling over. Through wheezing guffaws, he manages to get out:*

"Oh man...that was too perfect! I know good ol' Logie-bear can't resist trying to piss me off when I'm playing possum. Your bedside manner needs some serious work though, seriously. A little CPR wouldn't have killed ya!"

*Finally catching his breath, Wade collapses onto a rickety bar stool, kicking his feet up onto the debris-covered bar top. Propping his hands behind his head, he surveys the utterly demolished interior of the once cozy bar.*

"Daaamn! You guys really did a number on this place, huh? I leave you alone for five minutes and suddenly it's UFC up in here. Sheesh!"

*Hopping back to his feet, Wade unsheathes one of his katanas and experimentally pokes a huge sabertooth claw-shaped hole clear through the solid oak counter. Whistling, he glances back at Logan and Vergil.*

"Sooooo...we gonna talk about the eight hundred pound wampa in the room? And by wampa I mean Victor I-Have-Anger-Issues Creed. Pretty sure he wasn't here for the mojitos, if ya catch my drift."

*Wade's masked eyes narrow, his usual joking demeanor fading. Getting ambushed by Francis was humiliating enough, but having Sabertooth crash the party with his own grudge match really soured Wade's buzz. And if Victor is getting all chummy with good ol' Ajax again, that spells trouble in his book. Hopping back onto his precarious bar stool perch, Wade points his sword accusingly Logan.*

"C'mon Wolvie, gimme the skinny! What's got furface and cue ball working together again? Please tell me your murdery clone hasn't reformed the Four Horsemen of Stuck-Up-Douchebaggery for shits and giggles. Cause we both remember how well that turned out last time!"

*Leaning forward intently, Wade waits for Logan's explanation, fingers drumming against the hilt of his katana. Normally he loves chaos, but even Wade knows some unstable elements mixing together could create a pretty volatile cocktail. One likely to blow up in all their faces if they aren't careful...*

name: Logan
mes:
*Logan shakes his head, a half-smirk tugging at the corners of his lips despite the chaos that just unfolded. Wade's antics never cease to amaze him, even when they border on absurdity. He takes a moment to let the banter settle in before responding, his gruff voice tinged with sarcasm.*

You’re a real piece of work, bub. Almost got yourself killed there, and you treat it like a stunt in a circus.

*He steps closer, fists clenched at his sides as he scans the wreckage of the bar, still brimming with adrenaline from the fight. The scent of blood—both his and Creed’s—lingers in the air, and Logan’s instincts are still on high alert. He rolls his shoulders back, shaking off the tension that had built up during the chaotic encounter.*

And yeah, Creed and Francis are a problem. Those two are bad news. They’ve got some twisted agenda, and it’s only a matter of time before they come back swinging.

*Logan’s gaze flickers to Wade, his expression hardening slightly as he continues.*

You know how Victor is; he won’t just let this go. The guy’s got a grudge as big as his ego, and that’s saying something.

*He plants his hands on his hips, the weight of the night’s events pressing down on him. Despite the sarcasm, there’s a hint of concern in his voice. He knows how reckless Wade can be, and he can't shake the feeling that things are only going to escalate from here.*

So yeah, no more playing dead. Next time we face those two, we need to be ready. I’m not about to let them sink their claws into any of us.

*Logan takes a deep breath, pushing back the worry that gnaws at the edges of his mind. He glances around the bar again, noting the shattered glass and overturned furniture, then back to Wade, a determined glint in his eyes.*

You want to keep it fun? Let's turn the tables on them. We need a plan. And that means no more stunts. You got that?

*With that, Logan's demeanor shifts slightly, the protective instinct flaring as he looks at Wade, ready to strategize and confront whatever comes next.*
